title: How to Fix an Xbox 360 Error E68

steps.title: Turn the Xbox 360 off and disconnect the power cord.
steps.content: Turn the Xbox 360 off and disconnect the power cord. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Remove the HDD (if present).
steps.content: Remove the HDD (if present). To remove the HDD from an "old" Xbox 360, press the button on the HDD and remove the HDD. To remove the HDD from a "Slim" Xbox 360, open the HDD door and pull the HDD out of the console. If there is no HDD installed in your console, go to the step 8. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Reconnect the power cord and turn the Xbox 360 on.
steps.content: Reconnect the power cord and turn the Xbox 360 on.

steps.title: Is your Xbox 360 now operating normally?
steps.content: Is your Xbox 360 now operating normally? If it is, turn the Xbox 360 off and go to next step. If the red light flashes again, go to the step 8.

steps.title: Place the HDD back in place.
steps.content: Place the HDD back in place. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Turn the Xbox 360 on.
steps.content: Turn the Xbox 360 on. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Does the red light flash again?
steps.content: Does the red light flash again? If it does, your HDD is defective and should be replaced. If the console is now operating normally, the HDD was loose. You can now enjoy gaming. [6] X Research source

steps.title: If the console is not operating even without the HDD in place, one of connected accessories may be defective.
steps.content: If the console is not operating even without the HDD in place, one of connected accessories may be defective. Follow the next steps to check the accessories. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Unplug all USB-devices (such as thumb drives, cooling fans, battery chargers, controllers) and memory units.
steps.content: Unplug all USB-devices (such as thumb drives, cooling fans, battery chargers, controllers) and memory units. [8] X Research source

steps.title: If the console is now operating normally, one of the accessories is damaged or was connected loose.
steps.content: If the console is now operating normally, one of the accessories is damaged or was connected loose. Turn the Xbox 360 off and reconnect one of the accessories then turn the Xbox 360 on. Repeat this with all other accessories. If the Xbox 360 operates normally after reconnecting all accessories, one of them was connected loose. You can enjoy gaming. [9] X Research source

steps.title: If your Xbox 360 is showing E68 error even without HDD and accessories connected, it is defective.
steps.content: If your Xbox 360 is showing E68 error even without HDD and accessories connected, it is defective.
